qas.question: When did Public Safety Canada unveil Canada's Cyber Security Strategy?
What outlines the ongoing implementation of the Cyber Security Strategy?

answers.text: The Action Plan 2010–2015 for Canada's Cyber Security Strategy

qas.question: What outlines the responsibilities and provides a plan for coordination during a cyber incident?

answers.text: The Cyber Incident Management Framework for Canada

qas.question: Canadian cyberspace was boosted by who?
Multiple departments were involved in what?

plausible_answers.text: coordinated response between government and other partners in the event of a cyber incident.

qas.question: What type of plan is provided?

plausible_answers.text: to boost the security of Canadian cyberspace

qas.question: Why was a cyber security plan unveiled in October of 2010?

plausible_answers.text: securing government systems, partnering to secure vital cyber systems outside the federal government

qas.question: Who is the security measure meant to help the most?
When was Public Safety Canada founded?
How many departments does the new strategy involve?
What was the predecessor to Canada's Cyber Security Strategy?
When was the Speech from the Throne?

context: On <a0_0><b12_0>October 3, <b8_0>2010<b12_0/><b8_0/><a0_0/>, <b10_0>Public Safety Canada<b10_0/> unveiled Canada’s Cyber Security Strategy, following <b3_0>a Speech from the Throne<b3_0/> commitment <b6_0>to boost the security of Canadian cyberspace<b6_0/>. The aim of the strategy is to <b4_0>strengthen Canada’s "cyber systems<b4_0/> and critical infrastructure sectors, support economic growth and protect Canadians as they connect to each other and to the world." <b9_0>Three<b9_0/> main pillars define the strategy: <b7_0>securing government systems, partnering to secure vital cyber systems outside the federal government<b7_0/>, and helping Canadians to be secure online. The strategy involves multiple departments and agencies across the Government of Canada. <a2_0>The Cyber Incident Management Framework for Canada<a2_0/> outlines these responsibilities, and provides a plan for <b5_0>coordinated response between government and other partners in the event of a cyber incident.<b5_0/> <a1_0><b11_0>The Action Plan 2010–2015<b11_0/> for Canada's Cyber Security Strategy<a1_0/> outlines the ongoing implementation of the strategy.
